article_title: Receivership program transforming blight in Providence
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox

article_metadata.description:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. — A year ago, former Mayor Angel Taveras announced he would ramp up the city's receivership program to deal with abandoned houses in neighborhoods still struggling to recover from the foreclosure crisis.
At the time, the city had identified about 650 vacant properties. How has the receivership program fared under Mayor Jorge Elorza, a former Housing Court judge?
As of Sept. 3, there were 54 properties in the receivership program, and about another 50
article_metadata.author: Christine Dunn
